lines.text: Oh, what's that?
You wouldn't understand. This is a map.
Oh, sure, I know what a map is. It's what you take every afternoon when you're tired. I always take an afternoon map.
An afternoon map?
Sure.
I bet when you went to school, you never even reached the fifth grade.
Aw, don't be silly. I spent three of the happiest years of my life in the fifth grade.
Maybe I'd better murder them and get it over with, hmm?
Don't talk so loud!
I always talk loud. I'm a sheriff.
Can you take care of us?
Oh, yes, I can give you a room and a hot bath now.
You give me the room. I'll take the bath myself.
Oh, Pinky, dear, he didn't actually mean he'd bathe you.

[after a pause he laughs]
Skip it, dear.
Pardon me, do you and your husband want a bath too?

[laughs and giggles]
Oh, you say the funniest things!
Why?
Why funny? Don't you and George take baths?
Well, yeah, but not together.
How do you feel?
I feel as though the Russian Army has been walking over my tongue in their stocking feet.
Now, listen to me, Honest John, why do you drink so much?
Because I like it.
Everything you like to do is wrong.
According to you, everything I like to do is either illegal, immoral. or fattening.
Breakfast will be ready in six minutes.
Six minutes?
Yeah, I just put on two three minute eggs.

[Deadpanned]
Three minutes apiece'

[Referring to her husband's grips]
Well, did you manage to close it?
Well, why not? The Egyptians built the Pyramids, Napoleon crossed the Delaware, I should be able to close a bag!

[Looking at John's warped pool cue]
It's seems crooked, isn't it?
I'd like to see something in this joint that isn't crooked!
My name is Grace, but everybody calls me Gracie for short.

Gracie, when we get inside to answer the ad, please let me do the talking because every day you learn more and more about less and less until finally the day will arrive when you'll practically know everything about nothing

[Seemingly flattered]
Oh, George, whu don't you say things like that when we're out in company.

[Seeing a horseshoe stuck in the tire]
A horseshoe! That's good luck!

[Sarcastically]
Yes, this is perhaps the happiest moment of my life.
Oh, the tire is flat isn't it?
Only on the bottom.

[Giggling]
Yes.
John?
Yeah?
Are you busy?

[Sarcastically]
I'm about as busy as a pickpocket in a nudist colony.
Shut your suitcase.
Flora. Bounce.
Ohhh... don't ever cross him or he'll tear ya to pieces.
It's the old saying... It takes a thief to catch...
AHEM!
ah, must have been thinking about something else.
